The NSDAP produced a weekly poster with a quotation that could be displayed in party offices public buildings etc They were published in large editions averaging 450 000 weekly during the early war years and were part of the visual face of the Third Reich Leading artists such as Hoyer frequently did the design They first appeared in 1937 Before January 1939 issues were published both by the Reichspropagandaleitung and the individual Gaue After that with the exception of Gau Sachsen which published its own into 1941 all issues came from Munich My own incomplete collection runs to spring 1944 During the early war years about 450 000 copies were printed each week Somewhere around 1100 appeared between 1937 and 1944 The exact number is hard to determine since it is unclear how many were issued by the various Gau propaganda offices Some published them weekly for about two years others may have issued only a few before using those issued by Munich A great cause is not won by half measures The greatest prize demands the highest effort Theodor Fontane As long as an enemy stands on Germany s soil hate is my duty and my virtue vengeance Heinrich von Kleist In general thinking together is always necessary chattering together is not Gottfried Keller Salvation Heil does not fall from heaven It must be seized Joseph von Eichendorff He who wants to fight the Devil should stand on his own feet and grit his teeth not hide under the robe of the holiest angel Wilhelm Raabe As long as I breathe I will not give up Joseph von Eichendorff God gives us nuts but he does not crack them for us Goethe As the man is so is his god Goethe We belong to the generation that strives to rise from darkness into light Goethe If you never risk life you will never win life Schiller I want to seize fate by its throat I will never bend before it Beethoven To be German means to do something for its own sake Richard Wagner Only when I create am I completely myself Richard Wagner Only the most transforming deed shows the world what is important and subordinates ordinary interests Richard Wagner Germany is where the strong hearts are Ulrich von Hutten Paradise lies in the shadow of the sword Friedrich Nietzsche He who wants what is necessary cannot be overcome Friedrich Nietzsche A person must be inspired by an idea if he is to accomplish something great Gneisenau He who remains uninvolved and dispassionate at times of great patriotic battles does not deserve to experience them Heinrich von Treitschke Be what you want but whatever you are have the courage to be it completely Albert Leo Schlageter Farmers and soldiers stand hand in hand to give the people its daily bread and to protect the freedom of the Reich Joseph Goebbels There is no socialism that does not apply to one s own people Adolf Hitler See all Düsseldorf Essen Köln Aachen Sachsen Schleswig Holstein Südhannover Braunschweig Weser Ems Westphalen Süd Scattered issues National 1937 1941 National 1942 1944

Hoovervilles in the 1930s Amazing Vintage Photographs That Capture Everyday Life in the Shanty Towns during the Great Depression Many of the shanty towns that sprung up all over the United States during the Depression were facetiously called Hoovervilles because so many people at the time blamed President Herbert Hoover for letting the nation slide into the Great Depression vintage everyday Hoovervilles in the 1930s Amazing Vintage Photographs That Capture Everyday Life in the Shanty Towns during the Great Depression
